title: RobbyN789
author: RobbyN789
content: Hi,How can i attach a picture on this??Bascially, using electrum wallet, i have bitcoin, i want to deposit to a casino 100euro of bitcoing ( long story elsewhere on this forum, new to this, was going to cash out a few hundred euros the casino sent me, right now, thought i would deposit back - so i can carry on playing a few slots..call me foolish i know )BUT, i checked, the casino does not charge a fee ( i send them a screenshot of message on electrum wallet comes up ) The numbers are, Amount to be sent - 0.00629 mBTCMining fee - 0.00223 mBTCWARNING - The fee for this transaction is unusally high ( 35.4% )There isn a 'ADVANCED' tab - and also ETA Rate ( click on that and jumps to 38% )SO..... is the 'mining fee' the problem...could it be because initially this came from a casino?  ( curious to know..because if thats the case..then all a waste of time...IF..i use HodleHodle to sell it to cash ( would like to do )..then maybe..thats the drawback ..the bitcoin coming from this casino?  No?  off the track?  i hope so...as puts me off obviously.OR..am i doing something wrong.   Clicked deposit button on casion, gives me the address and 100euro equate to that 0.00629 ( i assume )....and they say they dont take a fee..so its my end.Thoughts welcome, bare in mind a newbie here, so plain speaking else you lose me!!!!THANKS for your time.

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: The m stands for milli. 1 mBTC is 0.001 Bitcoin.So you're trying to send a tiny amount instead of 1000 times more.If you want, you can change the display units in Electrum's settings.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Loyce is right.Go to Tools->Preferences, change Base unit from mBTC to BTC and try to make the transaction using BTC as denomination.Even more, you should be able to set the fee to 1 sat/vByte, which should get your transaction confirmed before tomorrow morning. But first change to BTC, since you were sending too low amount to the casino.

comments.author: RobbyN789
comments.body: Oh right, ok thanks for that. So much to learn. Ok I will try that..but you mentioned, might confirm tomorrow etc...ideally, like a mastercard transaction, wanted immediately...so might wise up and not send...then again...

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: RobbyN789 on January 08, 2023, 06:05:12 PMbut you mentioned, might confirm tomorrow etcI suggest you take a look at https://mempool.spaceYou'll see that the last few blocks were mined without being full. Still, in "waiting" there are already transactions for more than a block. So if you send now at 1 sat/vByte there is a chance it won't be mined exactly in the next block, instead 1-2 (or more) blocks later. I cannot foresee the future, hence I can't tell when. But it's reasonable to guess that's not too long, especially as it's week-end (in working days it's more congested).But if you don't want to wait, just use higher fee. You will see that even now pay fees like 100-300 (or more) sat/vByte. Imho it's wasted money, but you can do that too if you're such in a hurry.Mastercard fast will still not happen, a block need to be mined, which can happen in the next second after your transaction was sent (by you) - if you're overly lucky - or even in an hour - if you're unlucky or have set rather low fee. Keep in mind that the average is meant to be one new block at every ~10 minutes.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Quote from: RobbyN789 on January 08, 2023, 05:29:52 PMSO..... is the 'mining fee' the problem...could it be because initially this came from a casino?  ( curious to know..because if thats the case..then all a waste of time...IF..i use HodleHodle to sell it to cash ( would like to do )..then maybe..thats the drawback ..the bitcoin coming from this casino?  No?  off the track?  i hope so...as puts me off obviously.OR..am i doing something wrong.   Clicked deposit button on casion, gives me the address and 100euro equate to that 0.00629 ( i assume )....and they say they dont take a fee..so its my end.Thoughts welcome, bare in mind a newbie here, so plain speaking else you lose me!!!!THANKS for your time.You are doing fine, there is no problem with the mining fee.  The reason for the notification of 38% is that you send a very small amount and the mining fee is ratio'ed on your amount sent. It is like sending $1.5  with a fixed processing fee of $1 definitely it will give you a notification that your fee is around 66% of your transaction but if you send an amount of $20 with the same processing fee, it would be different. So try to send a larger amount and you will notice that the warning will not trigger.
